column4: American Airlines to trim Cuba flight schedules
column5: NEW YORK American Airlines Group Inc  will cut nearly 25 percent of its flights to Cuba in 2017  a company spokesman said on Thursday  attributing the move to travel demand rather than the election of Republican Donald Trump as U.S. president.

column4: Amgen  Allergan apply for European nod for Avastin biosimilar
column5: Amgen Inc and Allergan Plc said they have submitted an application to the European health regulator seeking approval of their biosimilar version of Roche Holding AG's blockbuster cancer treatment  Avastin.

column4: Ontario health ministry to probe alleged Costco pharmacy kickbacks
column5: Costco Wholesale Corp  said on Thursday that Ontario's health ministry would launch a probe into allegations it got illegal kickbacks from drugmakers  becoming the Canadian province's second regulator to scrutinize the matter.

column4: German supermarkets Edeka  Rewe agree to take over rival Kaiser's
column5: DUESSELDORF  Germany Germany's largest supermarket group Edeka and rival Rewe on Friday agreed a deal to take over the loss-making Kaiser's chain  potentially ending years of uncertainty over the future of the group.

column4: NASCAR  Monster Energy reach sponsorship agreement
column5: NASCAR said on Thursday it reached an agreement that will see energy drink company Monster Energy become the title sponsor for the stock car racing series starting with the 2017 season.

column4: Sirius reapproaches Pandora for a takeover: source
column5: Satellite radio company Sirius XM Holdings Inc's Chairman Greg Maffei recently made a fresh approach to internet radio provider Pandora Media Inc and expressed interest about a potential takeover  according to a source familiar with the matter.

column4: Starbucks' CEO transition unlikely to stymie growth: analysts
column5: Starbucks Chief Executive Howard Schultz's decision to step down is unlikely to hamper growth at the world's biggest coffee chain as his successor Kevin Johnson is well suited to take the helm  analysts said. | Video

column4: Starbucks CEO steps down to focus on high-end coffee  shares fall
column5: Starbucks Corp  co-founder Howard Schultz will step down as chief executive to focus on new high-end coffee shops  handing the top job to Chief Operating Officer Kevin Johnson  a long-time technology executive.

column4: Citic-Carlyle near deal to buy McDonald's China assets: source
column5: A consortium led by private-equity firm Carlyle Group  and Chinese conglomerate Citic Group Corp has neared a deal to buy McDonald's Corp's  stores in China and Hong Kong for up to $3 billion  a source with direct knowledge of the matter said. | Video

column4: Citic-Carlyle near deal to buy McDonald's China assets: source
column5: A consortium led by private-equity firm Carlyle Group  and Chinese conglomerate Citic Group Corp has neared a deal to buy McDonald's Corp's  stores in China and Hong Kong for up to $3 billion  a source with direct knowledge of the matter said. | Video

column4: Blackout ramps up pressure on Alcoa Australian aluminum smelter
column5: MELBOURNE A blackout that forced Alcoa Corp to shut one of two potlines at its Portland aluminum smelter in Australia will ratchet up costs further and may put the plant's future in jeopardy  analysts said on Friday.

column4: Alibaba is not buying India's Snapdeal: source
column5: SAN FRANCISCO China's Alibaba Group Holding is not buying Indian e-commerce company Snapdeal and is not in talks to do so  a person familiar with the matter said on Thursday  dampening talk that an acquisition was in the works.

column4: Amgen  Allergan apply for European nod for Avastin biosimilar
column5: Amgen Inc and Allergan Plc said they have submitted an application to the European health regulator seeking approval of their biosimilar version of Roche Holding AG's blockbuster cancer treatment  Avastin.

column4: Investor Cuban to testify at Senate hearing on AT&T-Time Warner deal
column5: WASHINGTON Billionaire investor Mark Cuban will be among the witnesses  scheduled to testify at a U.S. Senate Judiciary panel hearing on Dec. 7 on AT&T Inc's  proposed $85.4 billion acquisition of Time Warner Inc .

column4: Becton Dickinson wins reversal of $340 million syringe award
column5: A federal appeals court on Friday threw out an antitrust verdict that ordered medical device maker Becton Dickinson and Co  to pay rival Retractable Technologies Inc  $340 million in damages over its marketing of safety syringes.

column4: Becton Dickinson wins reversal of $340 million syringe award
column5: A federal appeals court on Friday threw out an antitrust verdict that ordered medical device maker Becton Dickinson and Co  to pay rival Retractable Technologies Inc  $340 million in damages over its marketing of safety syringes.

column4: BlackRock's Rieder expects Fed to raise rates twice in 2017
column5: NEW YORK The U.S. Federal Reserve will likely raise interest rates twice in 2017 following an expected rate hike at its Dec. 13-14 policy meeting  a top bond manager at BlackRock   the world's biggest asset manager  said on Friday.

column4: Brazil's Braskem shares jump as deal in graft probe seen imminent
column5: SAO PAULO Shares in Braskem SA soared 10 percent in their biggest intraday gain in more than two months on Friday after Latin America's largest petrochemical firm said it is in advanced talks with authorities in Brazil and the United States for a leniency agreement related to a massive corruption scandal.

column4: Delta Air to sell gasoline and diesel as losses at its refinery climb
column5: NEW YORK Delta Air Lines Inc is preparing to market gasoline from a refinery it owns outside Philadelphia  signaling a shift in strategy toward managing the plant as a commercial refiner rather than a dedicated jet fuel supplier.

column4: Delta Air Lines lowers profit forecast due to new pilot contract
column5: Delta Air Lines Inc  said on Friday it would take a $475 million hit in the fourth quarter from a new contract that hikes pilots' pay retroactively to the beginning of 2016.

column4: Deutsche Bank to pay $60 million to settle U.S. gold price-fixing case
column5: NEW YORK Deutsche Bank AG has agreed to pay $60 million to settle private U.S. antitrust litigation by traders and other investors who accused the German bank of conspiring to manipulate gold prices at their expense.

column4: Deutsche Bank cuts ties with 3 400 clients in trading business
column5: FRANKFURT Deutsche Bank's Global Markets division will cut ties with about 3 400 clients in its debt and equities sales activities  the bank said on Friday.    Deutsche Bank will immediately cease debt sales services to some financial institutions and hedge funds as well as equity sales activities  the execution of equities trading orders and  equity structuring activities for some clients  a spokesman said  citing an internal memo.

column4: As winter nears  Dakota Access faces frigid weather and costly delays
column5: HOUSTON Delays to the Dakota Access Pipeline have added millions of dollars to Energy Transfer Partners' construction tab - but even if the line is approved  the freezing temperatures will bring their own challenges to finishing the drilling process.

column4: Walters to step down as president of ExxonMobil Production Co
column5: Exxon Mobil Corp  the world's largest publicly traded oil company  said Tom Walters  president of ExxonMobil Production Co  will retire after 38 years with the company.

column4: Russia's Rosneft  Exxon drop plans for Gulf of Mexico oil development: Ifax
column5: MOSCOW Russia's largest oil producer Rosneft and ExxonMobil have decided not to proceed with joint development of oil blocks in the Gulf of Mexico due to "lack of prospects"  Interfax news agency quoted Rosneft as saying on Friday.

column4: Ford recalls 680 000 vehicles including Fusion  MKZ
column5: Ford Motor Co said on Friday it will recall about 680 000 of its Ford Fusion and Lincoln MKZ sedans to fix a seat belt issue.

column4: Trump considering Goldman Sachs COO Cohn for energy secretary: Fox Business Network
column5: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump is considering Goldman Sachs Group President and Chief Operating Officer Gary Cohn for energy secretary  Fox Business Network reported on Thursday  citing unnamed sources.

column4: Honda outselling Toyota in China  sets up photo finish for 2016
column5: BEIJING Honda Motor Co's  sales in China surpassed those of Toyota Motor Corp  for the first 11 months of 2016 as new models lured consumers and set the Japanese rivals up for a photo finish in their rankings for full-year sales in the world's top auto market.

column4: Actelion's silence has hedge funds betting big on J&J deal
column5: ZURICH Actelion's silence speaks volumes to the dozens of event-driven hedge funds piling into the Swiss biotech firm  betting that Johnson & Johnson's (J&J)  approach will result in an outright takeover and handsome returns.

column4: Johnson & Johnson hit with over $1 billion verdict on hip implants
column5: A federal jury in Dallas on Thursday ordered Johnson & Johnson  and its DePuy Orthopaedics unit to pay more than $1 billion to six plaintiffs who said they were injured by Pinnacle hip implants.

column4: Exclusive: Trump financier Ladder Capital explores sale - sources
column5: Ladder Capital Corp   a real estate investment trust which has bankrolled much of U.S. President-elect Donald Trump's property development  is exploring the possibility of a sale  according to people familiar with the matter.

column4: Brazil court calls McDonald's to hearing for alleged labor violations
column5: SAO PAULO Brazilian labor authorities on Friday called local McDonald's Corp  representatives to a hearing on Dec. 13 over alleged violations of the country's labor laws  and said they  could impose fines of up to 103 million reais ($30 million).

column4: Citic-Carlyle near deal to buy McDonald's China assets: source
column5: A consortium led by private-equity firm Carlyle Group  and Chinese conglomerate Citic Group Corp has neared a deal to buy McDonald's Corp's  stores in China and Hong Kong for up to $3 billion  a source with direct knowledge of the matter said. | Video

column4: Merck wins UK okay for Keytruda in lung cancer after price cut
column5: LONDON Britain's healthcare cost-effectiveness watchdog NICE has recommended use of Merck's immunotherapy drug Keytruda in certain lung cancer patients  after the U.S. drugmaker cut the price further for the state-run health service.

column2: New Oriental Education & Technology Group Inc
column4: Exclusive: U.S. standards council to investigate New Oriental after Reuters report
column5: MIAMI A U.S. standards-setting body said it would investigate New Oriental Education & Technology Group Inc  in the wake of a Reuters report that detailed allegations of academic fraud at the company.

column4: Sirius reapproaches Pandora for a takeover: source
column5: Satellite radio company Sirius XM Holdings Inc's Chairman Greg Maffei recently made a fresh approach to internet radio provider Pandora Media Inc and expressed interest about a potential takeover  according to a source familiar with the matter.

column4: PBF Energy changing Torrance alkylation tower  moves up planned work
column5: HOUSTON PBF Energy is in the process of changing the alkylation tower at its Torrance refinery and has moved up planned work at the facility originally slated for January  a source familiar with the matter said on Friday.

column4: Petrobras CEO says U.S. shale response to OPEC deal may cut oil prices
column5: SAO PAULO Pedro Parente  the chief executive of Brazil's state-run oil company Petroleo Brasileiro SA  said on Friday that the recent OPEC deal to limit production could be offset by increases in U.S. shale oil output.

column4: Brazil's Braskem shares jump as deal in graft probe seen imminent
column5: SAO PAULO Shares in Braskem SA soared 10 percent in their biggest intraday gain in more than two months on Friday after Latin America's largest petrochemical firm said it is in advanced talks with authorities in Brazil and the United States for a leniency agreement related to a massive corruption scandal.

column4: Buffett's Berkshire is urged to sell fossil fuel stocks
column5: A Nebraska nonprofit on Friday said it will propose that Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc  sell its investments in oil refiner Phillips 66  and other companies involved in fossil fuels over 12 years.

column4: Vivendi denies considering Telecom Italia involvement in pay-TV deal
column5: MILAN Vivendi  denied on Friday a press report that said the French media group was willing to resume talks with Italian broadcaster Mediaset  over a collapsed pay-TV deal and was considering involving Telecom Italia .

column4: Medical device maker Teleflex to buy Vascular Solutions for $1 billion
column5: Teleflex Inc said on Friday it agreed to buy fellow medical device maker Vascular Solutions Inc for about $1 billion.

column4: Investor Cuban to testify at Senate hearing on AT&T-Time Warner deal
column5: WASHINGTON Billionaire investor Mark Cuban will be among the witnesses  scheduled to testify at a U.S. Senate Judiciary panel hearing on Dec. 7 on AT&T Inc's  proposed $85.4 billion acquisition of Time Warner Inc .

column4: Honda outselling Toyota in China  sets up photo finish for 2016
column5: BEIJING Honda Motor Co's  sales in China surpassed those of Toyota Motor Corp  for the first 11 months of 2016 as new models lured consumers and set the Japanese rivals up for a photo finish in their rankings for full-year sales in the world's top auto market.

column4: Indiana agrees $7 million tax break to keep Carrier jobs in state: company
column5: WASHINGTON Indiana state officials have agreed to give United Technologies Corp  $7 million worth of tax breaks to encourage the company to keep at least 1 069 jobs at its Carrier unit in Indianapolis  Carrier and the state said on Thursday. | Video

column4: Wal-Mart to settle U.S. lawsuit over benefits for same-sex spouses
column5: Wal-Mart Stores Inc on Friday said it would pay $7.5 million to settle a U.S. lawsuit claiming it discriminated against gay employees nationwide by denying health benefits to their spouses.

column4: Wells Fargo offers to meet with Standing Rock Sioux before year-end
column5: Wells Fargo & Co said it would "be pleased" to meet with tribal elders from the Standing Rock Sioux tribe before year-end to discuss the U.S. bank's investment in the Dakota Access Pipeline  the company told the tribe in a letter dated Thursday.

column4: Argentine oil and gas workers to strike over YPF layoffs
column5: BUENOS AIRES Some 23 000 Argentine oil and gas workers will go on a 48-hour strike beginning on Monday to protest state-owned oil company YPF SA's decision to lay off at least 1 600 workers  a union leader said on Friday.

column4: Becton Dickinson wins reversal of $340 million syringe award
column5: A federal appeals court on Friday threw out an antitrust verdict that ordered medical device maker Becton Dickinson and Co  to pay rival Retractable Technologies Inc  $340 million in damages over its marketing of safety syringes.
